page.title: 11FLOWERS:SHELLEY NURSERY
page.content: The only flowers grown in the glasshouse at Shelley Nursery,Wigley are chrysanthemums,which start life as cuttings fro the Canary Islands.Every week,pots of 5 cuttings each are put under polythene for 5 days to root. These young plants are watered by overhead spray jets. After a week the pots are put on metal troughs and moved onto the travelling bench system.This allows the troughs to receive automatic watering and to be moved along every week for 10 to 12 weeks,when they are ready for sale.During this time the main buds and any side shoots are pinched out to allow the side buds to develop.Then the plants are put into polythene sleeves and packed 6 in a box for sale.There is thus a supply of plants for continuous all year sale.
